text:
Hi!

This is a two-part wish (I know, bad, bad, but they belong together)


1) I would love if there was a JMeter release blog where new releases are posted, so ppl can use an RSS-Service to get notified on new releases.

2) When a new release is made please also update the Wikipedia entry on JMeter (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jmeter) to refer to the new release. Currently the site still notes 2.5.1 as the lastest stable release (at least the english version, the german one seems to already have been updated).

Thanks for considering,
Immanuel
creator: immanuel.hayden@gmail.com

text: Edit: ok, the nr 2 seems to be a wikipedia problem ... when I visit http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jmeter I get the 2.5.1 but when I go to http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apache_JMeter I see 2.6 ... gonna file a bug report with them I guess ...
creator: immanuel.hayden@gmail.com
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Hello,
There is an RSS feed:
http://projects.apache.org/feeds/rss/jmeter.xml

Cool B-)

Would it be possible to add that feed to the jmeter.apache.org page somehow, so people can find it more easily? See http://webdesign.about.com/od/rss/a/link_rss_feed.htm

br,
Imm
creator: immanuel.hayden@gmail.com
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Done, Thanks for the link.
